text.0: come hither maruts on your lightning laden cars sounding with sweet songs armed with lances winged with steeds.
text.1: fly unto us with noblest food like birds o ye of mighty power.
text.2: with their redhued or haply tawny coursers which speed their chariots on they come for glory.
text.3: brilliant like gold is he who holds the thunder earth have they smitten with the chariots felly.
text.4: for beauty ye have swords upon your bodies as they stir woods so may they stir our spirits.
text.5: for your sake o ye maruts very mighty and wellborn have they set the stone in motion.
text.6: the days went round you and came back o yearners back to this prayer and to this solemn worship.
text.7: the gotamas making their prayer with singing have pushed the wells lid up to drink the water.
text.8: no hymn way ever known like this aforetime which gotama sang forth for you o maruts.
text.9: what time upon your golden wheels he saw you wild boars rushing about with tusks of iron.
text.10: to you this freshening draught of soma rusheth o maruts like the voice of one who prayeth.
text.11: it rusheth freely from our hands as these libations wont to flow.
